intro: Actephila trichogyna, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed actephila, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that are often overlooked due to their size. Actephila trichogyna is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
